That's a great idea! I think it would be really effective to create a social media challenge that encourages participants to share their own stories of why they're running for cancer research. By sharing their personal stories, participants can inspire and motivate others to join the cause, and the cancer society can showcase the impact of their research and the difference it makes in people's lives.

I also like the idea of using a branded hashtag to track the conversation and create a sense of unity among participants. And featuring a "Story of the Week" or "Runner of the Week" on your social media channels can help to keep the momentum going and inspire others to share their stories.

One thing to consider is how to make the challenge easy and accessible for participants to share their stories. You could provide some prompts or questions for them to answer, such as "Why am I running for cancer research?" or "What does cancer research mean to me?"
